author: Yahoo Life Shopping
title: 'After School Satan Club' draws concern from Tennessee parents: 'Find somewhere else'
text:
Fox News 'After School Satan Club' draws concern from Tennessee parents: 'Find somewhere else' Kyle Morris, Joshua Nelson December 24, 2023 at 11:00 AM ¬∑ 5 min read Link Copied Read full article Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below
A Tennessee elementary school's plan to allow the Satanic Temple to host an after-school program in its library is facing backlash from the students' parents and family members, one of whom insists the program is equipped to "negatively impact" children.
The Satanic Temple plans to host its first After School Satan Club (ASSC) in Cordova, Tennessee, on Jan. 10, 2024, at Chimneyrock Elementary School.
A flyer for the event describes the Satanic Temple as a non-theistic religion recognized by the Internal Revenue Service as a church. The church views Satan as a literary figure who represents a "metaphorical construct of rejecting tyranny and championing the human mind and spirit."
They added that the "Satan Club" will not attempt to convert students to any religious ideology. Instead, the Satanic Temple encourages "children to think for themselves."
SATANIC TEMPLE LEADER TOUTS AFTER-SCHOOL CLUB AS ALTERNATIVE TO RELIGIOUS CLUBS 'PROSELYTIZING' TO STUDENTS
Lucien Greaves, a co-founder and spokesman for the Satanic Temple, told Fox News Digital last week that the group started the after-school program as an alternative to other religious groups that were "proselytizing" to children.
One parent who asked that their identity remain anonymous due to the circumstances told Fox News Digital that she is "concerned and anxious" over the school's decision to play host to the group next year.
READ ON THE FOX NEWS APP
"This program has great potential to negatively impact children at school there," the parent said. "At a time when our kids should be growing and learning to be better people, this comes along. The name itself is just out of touch with what most of us want our kids exposed to."
"My kid won't be attending, and I hope other mothers and fathers out there will be mindful before allowing their children to participate," the parent added. "We're better than this ‚Äì as a group, as a community, and hopefully as a school."
The parent, who said her child expressed no interest in attending the program ever since they were made aware of it, said she hopes to see the school reverse its decision on allowing the program to take place in the school library.
"My child's school library isn't for this kind of program," the parent said. "My suggestion to the Satanic Temple would be to find somewhere else, maybe more accepting, to take this."
Ashley, who only provided her first name for interview purposes, is the aunt of a student who attends the school and said she hopes to see the program get canceled before it "perverts the minds of innocent children."
"My niece isn't much into religion, but that's OK because she's still young," Ashley told Fox News Digital. "What isn't needed is a group claiming to help kids think for themselves that pushes a view that Satan isn't a bad thing, I'm just not OK with that."
ASSC will provide teachers help to prepare "fun activities" centered on their seven fundamental tenets: benevolence, empathy, critical thinking, problem-solving, creative expression, personal sovereignty and compassion.
SATANIC TEMPLE LEADER CHALLENGES 'PATHETIC LITTLE COWARD' DESANTIS TO DEBATE OVER GROUP'S TAX-EXEMPT STATUS
ASSC will provide teachers help to prepare "fun activities" centered on their seven fundamental tenets: benevolence, empathy, critical thinking, problem-solving, creative expression, personal sovereignty and compassion.
"All After School Satan Clubs are based on activities centered around the Seven Fundamental Tenets and emphasize a scientific, rationalist, non-superstitious worldview," the event's flyer stated.
The ASSC, which was requested by a parent at the school , was running at eight schools last year. Four schools are currently running ASSC this school year.
After being made aware that a parent had requested the after-school program, Ashley questioned, "What parent does that?"
"This, to me, is only creating a wedge between those of different faiths and backgrounds. That's the part I'm not OK with," Ashley added. "Students shouldn't be subject to this information, no matter what it's being disguised as."
"ASSC only goes where it has been invited to give an alternative club to the other religious clubs already operating on school campus," June Everett, a spokesperson for ASSC, told Fox News Digital.
"Districts from last year have updated their policies to keep both the GNC and ASSC out, and some of the GNC's have not returned for this school year ‚Äì hence the reason we aren't active in those schools," Everett, the ASSC campaign director said.
She added, "Our active clubs are in California, Connecticut, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and soon to be Tennessee."
Everett explained further that school officials would not send out a permission slip for the club "due to an enforced flyer policy," even though the school had previously sent out permission slips for the Child Evangelism Fellowship's Good News Club that operates on campus, before school hours.
Some members and supporters of the Satanic Temple, the organization that sponsors the After School Satan Club, pose on Feb. 28, 2023, after a Saucon Valley school board meeting.
School district officials said they‚Äôre committed to upholding the First Amendment for all nonprofit organizations seeking to use their facilities outside of school hours.
SATANIC DISPLAY INSIDE IOWA STATE CAPITOL DESTROYED, MAN CHARGED: OFFICIALS
"The Satanic Temple, recognized by the Internal Revenue Service as a 501(c)(3) public charity, falls under this policy and has the same legal rights to use our facilities after-hours as any other nonprofit organization."
The co-founder and spokesman for the Satanic Temple told Fox News Digital last week that the group started the ASSC as an alternative to other religious groups that were "proselytizing" to children.
"We started the after-school program in 2016, and since then we've had a number of them in operation in various places, some of them still in operation, some of them not for whatever reason," said Lucien Greaves.
"People don't understand a lot of the pro-social values we rally around," he added. "We want people to know we're active in the communities, and we're doing productive things."
Greaves described the kind of activities that the ASSC would facilitate in this after-school program as a self-directed learning process that entails playing games, solving puzzles, activities, and other things that are educational for the kids ‚Äì where they can choose which ones they want to work with.
The Satanic Temple originally constructed a complex curriculum and consulted people in the field of education, but then changed it after realizing that it had become too elaborate.
"We really wanted to build something that would be a fruitful endeavor for the kids," Greaves said.
Original article source: 'After School Satan Club' draws concern from Tennessee parents: 'Find somewhere else'

title: Maltempo, a terra i pellegrini sardi diretti in Corsica per la visita del papa
text: Ancora grossi disagi nei collegamenti tra le due isole. La Regione all‚Äôattacco Santa Teresa. Il collegamento con la Corsica diventa sempre pi√π difficile. La tratta Santa Teresa-Bonifacio √® fuori uso a causa del guasto alla nave Giraglia e anche il collegamento provvisorio Golfo Aranci‚ÄìPorto Vecchio naviga in cattive acque. A farne le spese, ora, sono i pellegrini, i sacerdoti e alcuni operatori sardi che avrebbero dovuto raggiungere la Corsica in occasione della visita di papa Francesco ad Ajaccio. Il collegamento di domani, 14 dicembre, √® stato infatti cancellato a causa delle condizioni meteo avverse, proprio nel giorno che precede la visita del pontefice. ¬´√à l‚Äôennesima spia della fragilit√† della tratta che collega le due isole ‚Äì commenta Barbara Manca, assessora regionale ai Trasporti ‚Äì. Una vicenda di cui ci occupiamo quasi quotidianamente. La linea Bonifacio-Santa Teresa, quella ufficiale operata da Moby in continuit√† territoriale, √® fuori uso da circa un mese per il guasto di una delle pochissime navi dotate di dimensioni adeguate e delle necessarie certificazioni internazionali. Una situazione che ha fatto gi√† scattare da parte della Regione i dovuti accertamenti per valutare l‚Äôapplicazione delle sanzioni previste dal contratto di servizio in caso di sospensione del collegamento. La soluzione tampone, predisposta al di fuori del contratto di servizi dalla societ√† Moby con la messa in mare della nave Zaza tra Porto Vecchio e Golfo Aranci, √® anch‚Äôessa interessata da altre criticit√† dovute alle caratteristiche del porto francese quando si verificano condizioni meteo avverse. Infatti, a seguito delle segnalazioni arrivateci, abbiamo contattato l'armatore e appreso da quest'ultimo che le autorit√† francesi del porto di Porto Vecchio non consentirebbero l'ingresso in porto dell'imbarcazione, determinando la cancellazione della corsa e il conseguente disagio per chi avrebbe voluto recarsi nella vicina isola in occasione di questo importante evento. Abbiamo immediatamente preso contatto con le autorit√† corse per avere un riscontro su quanto sta avvenendo¬ª. ¬´Si tratta dell'ennesimo disagio vissuto dai passeggeri di questa tratta marittima ‚Äì aggiunge l'assessora dei Trasporti ‚Äì a riprova di quanto sia necessario che tutti gli attori interessati, esecutivi regionali delle due isole e governi nazionali dei due Paesi in primis, si siedano a un tavolo per trovare una soluzione definitiva agli annosi problemi registrati. Bisogna mettere in campo tutte le energie possibili per salvare un collegamento vitale per l'economia delle due isole¬ª. Una soluzione possibile alla risoluzione del problema nel brevissimo periodo √® stata messa sul piatto dagli uffici dell'assessorato regionale dei Trasporti. ¬´I nostri uffici ‚Äì spiega l‚Äôassessora Manca ‚Äì hanno gi√† inviato una richiesta di deroga, almeno temporanea, sulla classe di sicurezza richiesta per il naviglio da utilizzare su questa tratta (internazionale breve), nello specifico autorizzando la classe B invece della classe A attualmente richiesta. Con questa operazione il vettore incaricato potr√† mettere a disposizione del collegamento altre navi a sua disposizione¬ª. Primo piano Le nostre iniziative L‚Äôenciclopedia dei nomignoli Ecco tutti i soprannomi dei paesi segnalati dai nostri lettoridi Salvatore Santoni Le storie a met√†

author: Jason Burt
title: Too little too late for Tottenham as Brighton win six-goal thriller
text: On this evidence there is one team that should be challenging for a Champions League place. And it is not Tottenham Hotspur . Brighton were simply brilliant and fully deserving of a victory that capped an incredible 2023 and strengthened their own hopes of once again qualifying for European football. But Tottenham? They could have gone back above Manchester City and into fourth with a win but it felt like a game too many as they limp towards the transfer window opening and with head coach Ange Postecoglou already making it plain that he needs reinforcements. There has been so much praise, and rightly so, for Postecoglou but he needs help. Ange-ball cannot succeed with this personnel on an evening when the magic wore off a little. There was a hugely-impressive late rally, with two goals that distorted Brighton‚Äôs dominance and even the glimmer of an incredible, improbable comeback. But do not be fooled. Brighton absolutely deserved this and more. There were no excuses. Spurs were missing a host of players but Brighton, a club with fewer resources, could top that. They had even more out and had to make more changes. Follow latest reaction below... 10:04 PM GMT Happy night for Brighton fans LOVE this team! üíô [pic.twitter.com/WKtJGxjCG9] ‚Äî Brighton & Hove Albion (@OfficialBHAFC) [December 28, 2023] 09:58 PM GMT Good year for Brighton 2023 has been a great year for Brighton üôå [pic.twitter.com/Tm2QfxJUJU] ‚Äî Amazon Prime Video Sport (@primevideosport) [December 28, 2023] 09:57 PM GMT Tottenham‚Äôs Son Heung-min speaking to PLP ‚ÄúIt is a very disappointing performance. This is not how we‚Äôve approached the season. This performance was nowhere near the level we want to play at. We know what our mistakes were but now is not the time to point fingers at each other because the games are coming fast. ‚ÄúWe have to talk about the first half and the early parts of the second half rather than the end. We know we have to play like that from minute one. We have to take the lesson again and move on. Every team is strong in the Premier League and if we‚Äôre not playing like the last 15 minutes in every game we‚Äôre going to struggle and this has to be a big wake-up call. ‚ÄúBefore they scored the goal we had good pressures and a couple of actions where we could have done better. Brighton were more clinical than us and then the penalties caused big problems for us. We have to be more focused on the penalty, it is a big detail. The first half was not our game and not us. We have to take a big, big session.‚Äù 09:54 PM GMT Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou speaking to the BBC ‚ÄúIt is fair to say we looked like a tired team today, which is understandable. We‚Äôve asked a lot of these players for a very long time and we lacked a little bit of energy today. They are a good team and we struggled to cope with them. We hung in there and that‚Äôs all you can ask for, they left everything out there. ‚ÄúThere are no grumbles from me with the penalties. They were clear and obvious. It‚Äôs amazing that VAR picks up everything apart from a tackle that maybe puts out another of our players. ‚ÄúThere were positives at the end this group of players are giving everything at the moment. It is demanding to play the football we ask and they are doing it week in week out. It‚Äôs not for a lack of effort. ‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt been able to give the players a break at all and what we ask is pretty taxing.‚Äù 09:49 PM GMT Brighton striker Danny Welbeck speaking to Amazon Prime On Pervis Estupi√±√°n‚Äôs goal: ‚ÄúIt was incredible. We‚Äôve given him a bit of stick because he‚Äôs taken a few opportunities where he has struck the ball from distance but today was incredible. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been out for a while and everybody is over the moon for him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got to get the technique right first and foremost and I think once the ball left his boot he knew that was in. It was a beautiful goal, and one he will remember forever.‚Äù On Brighton‚Äôs 2023: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been incredible. One that not many would have foresaw coming. We‚Äôve done well and set the standards of where we want to be and we can only build upon that now. We want more, we have hungry people within the club and we want to keep on getting better and better. ‚ÄúEven today we won 4-2 but we‚Äôre still disappointed for conceding two goals. There is always room for improvement.‚Äù 09:48 PM GMT Nervy ending for Brighton? When Brighton went 4-0 up with 15 minutes to go, all of their fans must have relaxed knowing the three points was absolutely guaranteed. But there were some nerves inside the AMEX when Tottenham got two goals back and they probably should have got at least a third in added time. Never in doubt‚Ä¶ üòÖ [pic.twitter.com/NfTmnpU1hk] ‚Äî Brighton & Hove Albion (@OfficialBHAFC) [December 28, 2023] 09:44 PM GMT Leaking goals 19 - Since the start of November, Spurs have conceded the joint-most goals in the Premier League (19, along with [Nottingham Forest]), while they have the highest xG against total in this period (21.4). Kulusevski has been booked for the foul on Welbeck. Pedro to take... 07:53 PM GMT 21 minutes: Brighton 1 Tottenham 0 Referee Jarred Gillett has stopped play and will go over to the monitor. Kulusevski was blatantly pulling Welbeck‚Äôs shirt just as the Brighton forward was about to smash the ball inside the six-yard box and it looks like a penalty. 07:51 PM GMT 20 minutes: Brighton 1 Tottenham 0 Brighton have their first corner of the night after Porro blocks Pedro‚Äôs cross. It is swung in by Gross and van Hecke‚Äôs header hits the post. The Brighton players then go nuts appealing for a penalty. VAR is checking... 07:48 PM GMT 17 minutes: Brighton 1 Tottenham 0 Brighton have another chance. The ball is shifted to Pedro on the left-hand side of the penalty area. He cuts inside onto his right and fires at goal but it is straight at Vicario. 07:43 PM GMT GOAL! Hinshelwood gets Brighton's opener Brighton take the lead. Pedro cuts in from the left onto his right and just keeps dribbling across the edge of the box. He feeds it to 18-year-old Hinshelwood on the right in acres of space, who smashes it past Vicario. 1-0 Brighton. Hinshelwood opens the scoring! Brighton‚Äôs early pressure is rewarded with an early goal ‚öΩÔ∏è [#PLonPrime] [#BHATOT] [pic.twitter.com/CCPdrMkGex] ‚Äî Amazon Prime Video Sport (@primevideosport) [December 28, 2023] 07:40 PM GMT 9 minutes: Brighton 0 Tottenham 0 It has certainly been an end-to-end start to this match and there could have already been two or three goals, not even 10 minutes into the game. 07:38 PM GMT 6 minutes: Brighton 0 Tottenham 0 Brilliant save from Vicario to deny Welbeck. The ball falls to Welbeck just inside the Tottenham box and he hits it with his stronger right foot. But Vicario springs to his left to make a diving save. It was a terrific save but Welbeck should have buried that. 07:36 PM GMT 5 minutes: Brighton 0 Tottenham 0 Early chance for Welbeck. author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Mitchell County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Mitchell County, Iowa from 1901-2000 was 18.6. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Mitchell County, Iowa experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Mitchell County, Iowa history.

title: Wegen Hornissen-Invasion: NRW-G√§rtner m√ºssen jetzt handeln/zahlen
text:
Alle G√§rtner in NRW aufgepasst: Im Umgang mit der asiatischen Hornisse ist nun Eigeninitiative gefragt. Die Beh√∂rden ziehen sich zur√ºck. NRW ‚Äì Die Asiatische Hornisse breitet sich in NRW weiter aus. Nun √§ndert sich der Umgang mit dem Insekt grundlegend: Nester werden k√ºnftig nicht mehr fl√§chendeckend entfernt, wie bisher. Die Beh√∂rden stufen die Hornisse inzwischen als ‚Äûetabliert‚Äú und ‚Äûweit verbreitet‚Äú ein. Damit ist sie kein Fr√ºhwarn-Fall mehr ‚Äì sondern eine feste Gr√∂√üe im √ñkosystem, mit allen Folgen.
Wegen Hornissen-Invasion: NRW-G√§rtner m√ºssen jetzt zahlen Bisher waren es die Unteren Naturschutzbeh√∂rden in NRW, die konsequent Nester beseitigt haben. Diese Zeiten sind vorbei, wie die Beh√∂rde in Oberhausen informiert. Grundst√ºckseigent√ºmer in ganz NRW m√ºssen sich k√ºnftig selbst k√ºmmern ‚Äì und auch f√ºr die Kosten aufkommen.
Die Bek√§mpfung erfolgt nur noch an Konfliktpunkten, wenn etwa Menschen, Imkereien oder Einrichtungen gef√§hrdet sind. F√ºr Fragen steht weiterhin die Naturschutzbeh√∂rde zur Verf√ºgung ‚Äì doch eine Nestentfernung auf Staatskosten gibt es nicht mehr. Die Asiatische Hornisse gilt als invasive Art. Es handelt sich also um ein nicht heimisches Tier, das sich in einem neuen Gebiet stark ausbreitet und dabei die dortige Natur, andere Arten oder den Menschen sch√§digt. In NRW besonders betroffen sind Honigbienen, die gezielt angegriffen werden.
Invasive Art in NRW auf dem Vormarsch ‚Äì G√§rtner m√ºssen nun aktiv werden Die Folge: schwache Bienenv√∂lker, geringere Best√§ubung, weniger Ernte. Auch Wildbienen und andere Best√§uber leiden unter dem neuen R√§uber. Das √∂kologische Gleichgewicht ger√§t ins Wanken ‚Äì und die Zahl der Hornissen w√§chst rasant. Allein 2024 gab es √ºber 1.300 Sichtungen in NRW, ein drastischer Anstieg.
Die Hornisse ist kleiner als ihre europ√§ische Verwandte. Auff√§llig sind ihr schwarzer K√∂rper und die gelben Beine. Von M√§rz bis Dezember baut sie gro√üe Nester, oft an schwer zug√§nglichen Stellen wie B√§umen oder Dach√ºberst√§nden. Wichtig: Sichtungen der Hornisse in NRW sollten gemeldet werden ‚Äì entweder direkt bei der Stadt oder √ºber Apps wie ‚ÄûMeine Umwelt‚Äú.
RUHR24 bei Google News abonnieren: Ihr wollt keine Nachrichten mehr √ºber Dortmund verpassen? Dann folgt RUHR24 bei Google News !
Asiatische Hornisse verbreitet sich in NRW ‚Äì Stich kann gef√§hrlich werden Wer ein Nest entdeckt, sollte es nicht selbst entfernen, sondern einen Experten zu Rate ziehen. Die Tiere k√∂nnen aggressiv reagieren. F√ºr gesunde Menschen ist ein Stich meist ungef√§hrlich. Dennoch kann das Gift Reizungen verursachen ‚Äì besonders an den Augen. Allergiker sollten auf jeden Fall Abstand halten und bei Sichtung oder gar Stich √§rztlichen Rat einholen.
Die fr√ºhzeitige Erkennung von Nestern bleibt der wichtigste Schritt. Je eher ein Nest gefunden wird, desto einfacher und kosteng√ºnstiger ist die Entfernung (mehr Freizeit-News aus NRW bei RUHR24).

author: Anonym
title: ‚ÄúMy fight serves! ¬ª: in the Assembly, the Abitbol law for the protection of minors adopted unanimously - The Limited Times
text: She is one of those who paved the way. At the beginning of 2020, Sarah Abitbol revealed in her book ‚ÄúUn si long silence‚Äù (Plon) the rapes suffered at the hands of her ex-trainer Gilles Beyer. With it, the scandal of sexual violence in sport broke out. This February 29, 2024, the former skater was able to observe with emotion the National Assembly unanimously adopt the bill proposed by Senator S√©bastien Pla (PS) with whom she worked for a long time, aimed at strengthening the protection of children in the sporting environment. ‚ÄúFour years ago, I was so ashamed, I was so guilty,‚Äù she says, moved. There, I am happy, happy for the protection of children and the new generation. It's another stone in the building. We continued this fight and today we have the reward with this political unanimity. ¬ª View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sarah Abitbol (@sarah.abitbol1975) More than 1,800 reports in two years Because as during its vote in the Senate in June (343 votes out of 343 votes cast), the National Assembly voted 207 votes out of 207 votes cast in favor of this proposal. This so-called ‚ÄúAbitbol‚Äù law will aim to strengthen the protection of minors and good repute in sport. Concretely, it must allow reinforced control of the profile and background of supervisors present within sports clubs. Consultation of bulletin no. 2 of the criminal record will be automatically carried out each year. The automated judicial file of perpetrators of sexual or violent offenses (FIJAIS) will also be consulted. Unanimity! My PPL aimed at Strengthening the protection of minors and respectability in sport, adopted in the Senate last June, has just been adopted by the National Assembly. Thank you very much to Sarah Abitbol and to Deputy Claudia Rouaux, rapporteur of the text to the Assembly. pic.twitter.com/vRcR0rt24H ‚Äî Senator S√©bastien Pla (@sebastienpla) February 29, 2024 Because the figures recording incidents of sexual violence speak for themselves. The Signal-Sports ministerial platform, launched in 2020 at the instigation of former minister Roxana Maracineanu, has ‚Äúcollected 1,800 reports over the last two years‚Äù, reports S√©bastien Pla. According to Marie Lebec, the Minister of Relations with Parliament, ‚Äúmore than 1,250 cases of violence, 90% of which are of a sexual nature‚Äù have already been processed. ‚ÄúMy fight serves! By having succeeded in speaking four years ago, I opened the way, and contributed to the liberation of speech,‚Äù rejoices Sarah Abitbol, mentioning cultural news and the recent speaking engagements of Judith Godr√®che. ‚ÄúA safety net‚Äù around children The objective is to give the club and the federations clear tools to protect practitioners, particularly the youngest. ‚ÄúIt must be a safety net‚Äù around children, says the former skater. ‚ÄúFear must change sides,‚Äù insists Senator S√©bastien Pla. With this law, we make all leaders aware that the issue of the integrity of children is a priority.‚Äù A landmark vote five months before the start of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, and just a few months after the parliamentary commission of inquiry into dysfunctions within sports federations was held within the National Assembly itself. ‚ÄúIt comes at the right time,‚Äù appreciates Sarah Abitbol. We hope that the President of the Republic will very quickly sign this law so that it can be applied very quickly.‚Äù ‚ÄúProfound changes must be undertaken in the world of sport,‚Äù insisted socialist MP Claudia Rouaux, rapporteur of the bill while ‚Äúpaying tribute‚Äù to the victims, details AFP from the Palais-Bourbon. ‚ÄúIt will be much more difficult to slip through the cracks,‚Äù concludes the Senator from Aude, with the hope in the longer term that these tools will be made available to the entire associative sector and to all the structures welcoming young people, starting with that of culture, at the heart of a vast movement for the liberation of speech.

text:
Greenhouse gases record levels ‚Äì level 2
01-11-2024 15:00
The UN report says that the world is behind on climate change goals. Greenhouse gases, like carbon dioxide, are increasing faster than ever.
Over the last 20 years, these gases went up by 11%, and they rose even more in 2023 due to fossil fuels, forest fires, and a weather event called El Ni√±o. Experts are worried that forests may not absorb as much carbon now, which could cause more warming. Climate plans from the 2021 COP26 meeting didn‚Äôt lead to big changes. The UN says governments are not acting enough on their climate promises.
Next year‚Äôs climate conference, countries should create stronger plans, but scientists warn that emissions need to drop by half by 2030 for real progress.
Difficult words: fossil fuel (fuel from old plants and animals, such as gas or oil), absorb (to take in), progress (the process of getting better or improved).
